meanings.definition: To do occasional pieces of work for different employers without a long-term contract.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys jobbing as a freelance writer for various magazines.
meanings.sent2: He has been jobbing as a handyman in the neighborhood for extra income.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be jobbing around the house, exploring every nook and cranny.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was jobbing with ideas for her next creative project.
meanings.sent5: The students were jobbing diligently on their group assignment.

meanings.definition: To buy and sell goods or services for profit.
meanings.sent1: The entrepreneur is jobbing vintage clothing online.
meanings.sent2: They have been jobbing antiques at the flea market for years.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was jobbing acorns from one tree to another.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were jobbing between investing in stocks or real estate.
meanings.sent5: The company was jobbing electronics to customers worldwide.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in small-scale or irregular work for payment.
meanings.sent1: Her jobbing as a dog walker allows her to earn extra money.
meanings.sent2: The jobbing at the local fair was a great way for teens to make pocket money.
meanings.sent3: The clown's jobbing at the birthday party brought laughter to all the kids.
meanings.sent4: The artist's jobbing on weekends helped fund her passion for painting.
meanings.sent5: Jobbing as a delivery person kept him busy and paid the bills.
